data.title: Yearly & Monthly weather
data.meta_description: Newcastle, Australia - Climate and weather forecast by month. Detailed climate information with charts - average monthly weather with temperature, pressure, humidity, precipitation, wind, daylight, sunshine, visibility, and UV index data. The month with the most rainfall in Newcastle, Australia, is February, when the rain falls for 14.7 days and typically aggregates up to 79mm (3.11") of precipitation. Despite the absence of a definitive monsoon period, Newcastle faces a significant number of rainy days throughout the year, cresting at 15.6 days in March, and decreasing to a minimum of 10.2 days in August.
data.text:
Average temperature

Newcastle, Australia

The warmest month (with the highest average high temperature) is January (26.7째C).

The month with the lowest average high temperature is July (16.3째C).

The month with the highest average low temperature is January (20.3째C).

The coldest month (with the lowest average low temperature) is August (10.8째C).

Average daylight / Average sunshine

Newcastle, Australia

The month with the longest days is December (Average daylight: 14h and 18min).

The month with the shortest days is June (Average daylight: 10h and 0min).

The months with the most sunshine are November and December (Average sunshine: 9h and 48min).

The month with the least sunshine is June (Average sunshine: 5h and 48min).

Average UV index

Newcastle, Australia

The months with the highest UV index are January, February, November and December (UV index 6).

The months with the lowest UV index are May, June, July and August (UV index 4).

Average visibility

Newcastle, Australia

The months with the highest visibility are January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November and December (10km).

The months with the lowest visibility are January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November and December (10km).
